title: Cadus 2014 Gualtallary Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Odd aromas of curried meat and iodine are more unusual than off-putting. This feels a bit wide and heavy, with flatness to the palate. Flavors of roasted plum and savory spices suggest lamb curry, while this feels robust and aggressive on a slightly hot finish.

title: Campolargo 2015 Branco Barrica Arinto (Bairrada)
description: The typical citrus and bright fruits of the Arinto grape shine in this wine. It is lively and fruity with pear and kiwi flavors. A touch of wood adds a richer side to the wine. Drink now.

title: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2013 Artemis Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: A bold, leathery and savory wine, this offers dark chocolate and black pepper within a soft layering of full-bodied approachability and ripe, red berry and currant.

title: Spann Vineyards 2015 Betsy's Backacher White (California)
description: Nuances of vanilla and toasted baguette add flair to this full-bodied and textural wine. It has straightforward crisp apple and grapefruit flavors, a dry balance, and a taut, almost astringent finish.

title: Quinta dos Poços 2013 Reserva Red (Douro)
description: Spice from wood aging is the initial character of this wine. Then the fruit comes through more strongly to give the wine richness and structure. Drink from 2018.

title: Tenuta Duecorti 2012 Castelletto  (Barolo)
description: Earthy nose of dried underbrush, truffle and scorched soil give way to cranberry and sour cherry flavors. Dried herb and dark spice add some depth while tightly packed astringent tannins leave a mouth-puckering finish. It's rather straightforward but let the tannins relax for another few years then drink.

title: Quinta do Vale Meão 2014 Meandro do Vale Meão Red (Douro)
description: The second wine of Vale Meão, this is rich and fruity. It has enough structure to allow it to develop while also having plenty of red-berry fruits and soft tannins. Give this wine until 2019.

title: Quinta Dona Matilde 2013 Dona Matilde Reserva Red (Douro)
description: Red-berry fruits and soft tannins give a wine with some juicy acidity and spice. The firm aftertaste shows that it is still needs time. Drink from 2018.

title: Jamieson Ranch 2014 Whiplash Malbec (California)
description: This is a very good, medium-bodied wine. It has lightly oaky aromas, lots of fruit flavor, a smooth texture and an almost-sweet finish.

title: Jasper Sisco 2014 Zenith Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This Pinot is lightly peppery with fruit flavors of watermelon and strawberry. They're expanded with generous skin phenolic flavors from 50% whole cluster fermentation, then softened with aging in neutral oak. Though a light wine overall, it's complex and holds your attention.

title: K Vintners 2014 Powerline Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Coming off the winery's estate vineyard, this wine displays vibrant aromas of toast, honeysuckle and orange peel. The palate is rich and oily in feel, showing a mixture of fruit and barrel, with the latter not quite seeming to have fully integrated.

title: King Estate 2015 Chardonnay (Oregon)
description: This light and well-made wine drinks easily and tastes just as clean and fresh as you would expect from this Oregon producer. It's crisp and inviting, with a solid structure revolving around green apple fruit and fine details of just-picked herbs.

title: Leaping Lizard 2014 Merlot (California)
description: This is a light-bodied and full-flavored wine with a good, gripping texture and plenty of ripe plum and black pepper aromas. A fruity and beefy flavor carries through the finish.

title: Lima Smith 2013 Boa Vista Touriga Nacional (Douro)
description: A ripe, well-integrated wine, this is both structured and full of fruit. It is rich with perfumed tannins and with black fruits. Drink from 2018.

title: Lima Smith 2014 Quinta das Tecedeiras Reserva Red (Douro)
description: Still closed and firm, this is a dry, tannic and smoky wine. With the dark tannins, it will take a while to bring out the juicy fruits that are underneath. Drink this rich wine from 2020.

title: Manzwine 2014 Dona Fátima White (Lisboa)
description: Only recently identified, the Jampal is a rare and ancient local grape from the western Lisboa area, close to the ocean. It produces a crisp, tight and mineral-textured wine. This example is fresh, lively and bright with sliced apple and lime flavors and a fruity aftertaste. It is ready to drink.

title: Meyer Family Cellars 2013 Syrah (Yorkville Highlands)
description: Smooth and polished, this medium-bodied wine has attractive fruit and cinnamon aromas, generous dark-fruit flavors, and light touches of baking spices.

title: Greystone Cellars 2014 Petite Sirah (California)
description: Heady aromas like wood smoke, black pepper and new rubber tire lead to equally peppery, smoky flavors and a firm, nicely tannic texture. The wine is medium to full bodied and well concentrated.

title: Hill-Smith Estate 2014 Chardonnay (Adelaide Hills)
description: This hand-picked, wild-fermented Chardonnay offers a lot to like. Notes of toasted grain, ripe pear and melon create a balanced blend of citrusy fruit and oaky spice, while the refreshing pineapple and clove notes linger on the finish.

title: Opolo 2012 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Though a reserve bottling, this shows a very fresh and sprightly side of the grape rather than its dense face. Squeezed blackberries, just-picked thyme and a touch of burnt caramel show on the nose, while the palate offers Concord grape, boysenberry and iced-coffee flavors.

title: Palma Real 2015 Verdejo-Viura (Rueda)
description: Melon, nectarine and mild citrus aromas are clean and direct. This basic white is firm and balanced, while stone fruit, melon and white-pepper flavors end easy and fresh.

title: Parras Wines 2015 Evidência Red (Dão)
description: This structured wine has a strong mineral element. With black-currant and berry flavors, it is firm and still young. Swathes of rich fruit are sustained by solid tannins. Drink from late 2017.

title: Riposte 2015 The Dagger Pinot Noir (Adelaide Hills)
description: Pretty aromas of cherry and plum blossoms give way to fully ripe, slightly confectionary fruit, backed by hints of mocha. This medium-bodied Pinot Noir is supple in texture and softly dusty on the finish, making it an easy one to drink over the next couple of years.

title: Robert Mondavi 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Aromatics of rose and mint give this wine prettiness on the nose before getting into darker, richer components on the palate. Medium in build, it retains a sizable tannin presence in its youth, complemented by dark cherry and a char on the oak.

title: Roco 2014 Gravel Road Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: A mix of clones and vineyard sources, this is a bit rough and tumble, as the name might suggest. Hard cherry candy carries a touch of rubber, and some rugged tannins. That said, it's got plenty of punch and power.

title: Etablissements Thunevin 2014 Mauvais Garçon  (Bordeaux)
description: This is the branded Bordeaux from Jean-Luc Thunevin, so-called Bad Boy (Mauvais Garçon) of Saint-Émilion, now respected owner of Grand Cru Classé Château Valandraud. It is a richly smooth wine with touches of wood and generous blackberries. Concentrated and lightly tannic, it is fruity and ready to drink.

title: Milbrandt 2012 Vineyard Series Clifton Vineyards Grenache (Wahluke Slope)
description: Aromas of vanilla and cocoa mix with red fruit. The fruit flavors are full and palate coating but the oak seems a little too intense at times.

title: MooBuzz 2015 G-S-M (Central Coast)
description: Hibiscus and strawberry scents make an appealing invitation on the nose of this bottling, and then light cola and pepper spice up the ante. This would be a great red for warmer weather, served with a slight chill that would still allow the flavors of sandalwood, red cherry and marjoram to emerge.

title: Plantagenet 2013 Omrah Pinot Noir (Great Southern)
description: This light- to medium-bodied wine shows good varietal definition, offering crisp acids, silky tannins and tart cherry-cranberry fruit. Hints of tomato and smoke add interest to the bright fruit. Drink now–2020.

title: Quinta dos Poços 2014 Colheita Red (Douro)
description: Wood flavors dominate this young wine. It has structure and tannins, with concentrated toast and chocolate flavors. The extraction of the fruit gives the wine a bitter character. It should soften, so drink from 2019.
